name: Guavaberry Spring Bay Vacation Homes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Jemstone for 7 nights and had a splendid time. The views, the private pool, the hammock, the kitchen, the living room area, the separate sleeping area, and the service were all superb. We asked for a bouldering crash pad and it was delivered promptly at the start of our vacation. I would definitely stay here again. The only issue my girlfriend and I had that was no fault to the property were the birds that would wake us up early in the morning.
reviews.title: Jemstone is Pricey but Excellent

reviews.text: Our group of four adults and three children, ages eighteen months, seven, and fourteen, stayed with Guavaberry Spring Bay the week of July 16th - July 23rd. My wife and I and our two boys, the older of the children, have stayed with them several times before. Our friends had been to Virgin Gorda on day trips but never stayed on the island.
reviews.title: Guavaberry and Mondelo

reviews.text: As usual, Guavaberry was on top of everything, whether it be our car rental with Mahogany (truly an outstanding company) or our requests for a highchair and a pack-n-play. The company also reponded rapidly when the power went out (twice this trip), sending a person over to the house to make sure we had water. Note: this is an island issue, not a Guavaberry issue. I don't know how you could do things much better then they do. As always the commissary was well-stocked and continues to provide items at costs that are as good as, or in many cases better than, any other stores on the island.
reviews.title: Ideal place to stay

reviews.text: The villa we stayed in this trip is called Mondelo. The villa is located about a four minute walk from Mad Dogs and Top of the Baths and about a fifteen minute walk from Spring Bay. The villa has no a/c in the bedrooms, which would have been an issue with us if we had not known the villa was on the Atlantic side of the island. The breezes were constant all day and night and there were precious few occasions where any of us were remotely uncomfortable.
reviews.title: The BEACH HOUSE at Guavaberry Spring Bay is THE spot!

reviews.text: We decided on Mondelo because we felt it was a toddler friendly house. We were correct. You have to go up stairs to get to the house, but once you are there the house is all on one level. Of particular help was the pool area. The pool is surrounded by a low wall, just high enough to stop a toddler in their tracks.
reviews.title: Clean, compact and comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We live on Tortola and went to Virgin Gorda and stayed at Guavaberry Spring Bay for 2 nights. I loved that our house had a huge boulder right next to it, with a little access ramp so you could climb onto it and check out the view! The house was great, the only things I didn't like was the amount of bugs that seemed to get inside at night and the bed was really soft and not the most comfortable.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed being able to use the Commissionary whenever we wanted and liked that we could use the beach towels and return them and get fresh ones every day. Also, we arrived on the island at 9.30am and were allowed to check in to our room straight away and on our last day, we were told we didn't have to check out until we had to catch the 4.30pm ferry. I've never experienced that in any hotel, it made our stay really easy and enjoyable. I was also impressed at how the manager booked our ferry for us, arranged for the taxi to pick us up and drop us off at the ferry and also arranged our rental car. It was the easiest holiday I have ever planned, I didn't have to do a thing!
reviews.title: Las Brisas Casita Was Wonderful!

reviews.text: We went to the Baths the first day, such a short easy walk from Guavaberry. The next day we hired a car and explored the island and we both agreed that the part of the island where we were staying was the nicest - you can't beat those awesome boulders. Our last day was spent snorkelling at Spring Bay and exploring the Baths again. The Baths, Spring Bay, and Devil's Bay are all gorgeous beaches and to have them within a short walking distance from Guavaberry was fantastic.
reviews.title: Loved the accomodations and staff at Guavaberry

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will definately be going back to Virgin Gorda soon and I won't be staying anywhere else but Guavaberry!
reviews.title: Wonderful, Peaceful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary with a trip to Virgin Gorda. We usually spend our money on attractions and restaurants rather than lodging (after all, we're not on vacation to hang out in our room), but we decided to splurge and go with one of the "luxury" rentals at Guavaberry, Las Brisas Casita. We were not disappointed. The casita is absolutely beautiful - and perfect for a couple. I knew that the home did not have air conditioning, but we had zero problems with that (the breeze was delightful and, if we were ever too hot, we just jumped in the pool!) As others have mentioned, the landscaping was beautiful, and the casita was super-private (even though it was located steps from the main path to the Baths).
reviews.title: Beautiful view
Perfect spot, perfect price
reviews.text: My boyfriend, his 11-year-old son and I stayed five nights in the Cashew cottage and had a nearly perfect stay. Since there were no two-bedroom cottages available, we had a cot brought into the dining side of the two-room cottage and it worked out fine. We had all the comforts of home -- electricity, hot shower, cooking utensils and dishes. And the place was cleaned every day. The back deck has a nice view of the sunset and we played board games on the back table at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The honor-system grocery store next to the front office has most of what you might need in terms of food and toiletries.
reviews.title: A Little Piece of Heaven

reviews.text: The only drawback was some ants, but they were easily taken care of with a can of insecticide provided with the cottage. I suggest spraying some Off around your bed at night to deter other kinds of insects. The cottage also had some plug-in insect repellent devices, but they weren't needed.
reviews.title: A timeless getaway

likes.liked: — The beach setting and the staff
likes.disliked: — no see ums on the beach (not the hotels' fault...just part of nature)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I suggest renting a car because the island's destinations are not all within walking distance of the cottage. There are some spectacular mountainside roads on the island. But watch out for goats!
reviews.title: Excellent rate with a gorgeous beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cry of wild roosters could be heard throughout the day. There were beautiful roosters, hens and chicks to be seen everywhere.
reviews.title: Simple, convenient, relaxing, all in a beautiful spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Las Brisas Casita is everything we dreamed of and more! Even with touring the whole island, we believe the Guavaberry / Baths area of Virgin Gorda is the perfect location. You are with in walking distance to at least 6 beaches - Stoney Point, Devil's Bay, The Baths, Spring Bay with the Crawl, Big & Little Trunk. Plus you can walk to Spanish Town. GB service is wonderful, their cottages and rental villas are exceptional. Something for every style of comfort you'd like. Either rustic, to your own pool (like us!), or right on the beach! All have lovely views, lush surrounding & lots of neat boulders. Truly paradise. I could write a book with this review, but I'll try to stick to the key points.
reviews.title: Las Brisas Casita & VG, everything we dreamed of and more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: GB staff, Tina, Michelle & Valerie are super, from the first email, months before our arrival, to even when we got home (got a much needed email link for the wonderful swim belt I used). A taxi driver met us at the ferry and brought us to the main GB office to meet Tina, she showed us around there, how the food etc. works, TV lounge area. Then she drove with us to our Casita, it was about 7 pm and dark by now, & we were on hour # 36 without sleep (long travel route from Canada - 3 hrs to airport, have to arrive 3 hours ahead, 2 planes, & 1.5 ferry ride from St. Thomas). But we were finally IN paradise!
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations... Phenomenal. Highly recommended!

reviews.text: Fell in love with our Casita the second we walked in. And in daylight hours we were even more thrilled. The grounds are stunning & SO private. Tropical flowers, bushes & trees abound, making it very secluded. Casita is one of the private homes GB manages. We choose it because I love pools & it has its own fairly good size real pool, it was even over my head at the far end. One may ask why we'd need a pool when we are surrounded by lovely beaches - true! However it is dark early, by 7 pm, so we could use the pool in the evenings, which was fabulous. The weather is so nice there you could just walk right in, some nights the pool almost felt like a hot tub! Casita also has a TV & phone (the GB cottages don't). We didn't use the phone, but some TV at night was nice & I did watch the Royal Wedding! I'll always remember I was in paradise for that! :)
reviews.title: Wonderful Secluded Jewel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casita has a comfy King size bed, with fun bright coloured comforter. Nice wicker furniture to lounge in front of the TV. We had a large safe to keep stuff in, a numbered lock style, so no key to loose. We had daily maid service. We did our own dishes, but I'm sure they'd even do that, as they would put our dishes away from the drying rack. There is a container to put your feet into on you deck to wash the sand off before you come in the house, they'd clean that daily. I was wondering if there would be enough towels, needing them for the pool, beach & showering - there was shelves full of towels! The beach towels you can return to GB office & retrieve new ones. We had a drying rack on the pool patio for bathing suits & towels.
reviews.title: Lovely time in the sun.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm including a lot of photos, (well actually now I see it will only let me include 10). Maybe I can do more after? As they'll best describe Casita. We were never too hot, it has 3 patio doors & numerous windows. The breezes were plentiful, we never used the ceiling fans either. Our stay was end of April, beginning of May. This also was a good time for no bugs. Mosquitoes love me & always find me, so I had 2 bites - but for a whole week, that's amazing for me. Their mosquitoes are about half the size of ours? Casita has a full kitchen, with a fabulous Oster beehive blender that we used nightly for icy fruity rum drinks (yum! :) The fridge has an ice maker & ice packs. We had a cooler to use - which was wonderful. 2 jugs of water were in our fridge when we arrived & we just kept refilling those with tap water, it taste fine & obviously safe to drink. I always travel with empty Gatorade bottles, love their easy drink tops. We filled those with drink crystal packets we brought from home & we'd be set for liquids for our days at the beach. Brought a bunch (20) granola bars from home & they helped a lot too. Made breakfasts in our Casita, enjoyed on our patio by the pool. Had a lunch or two & a couple dinners on our front patio with views of the ocean. The bread at the commissary made lovely french toast. We didn't buy milk, hey when the rum is cheaper, you go with it! There was some olive oil in our cupboard so I used that in the frying pan, so just bought the bread, eggs & syrup. The Casita is pretty much a foot ball throw to Mad Dogs, seriously THAT close! Meaning the Top of the Baths restaurant is also right there. So we ate twice at each spot, being they were SO close & had free WiFi! (Will review those on their pages).
reviews.title: book it
